results.title: The Restless conscience
results.brief_description: A detailed documentary on the resistance to Hitler in Germany before and during World War II. The network of anti-Nazi activity in Germany that was active in the military and within the SS ranks from Hitler’s rise to power and into the war is profiled through discussion, first of the efforts by military leaders to gain the support of foreign nations in overthrowing Hitler’s government, and then of the range of assassination attempts and networks to smuggle Jews and other persecuted groups and individuals from the country. Through a collection of interviews including those with surviving members of the resistance and the families of those they helped, archival footage, and a critical commentary the program is a thorough exploration of the principles behind the movement as well as their activities.

results.title: The Rainbow and the forest
results.brief_description: Of all the butterflies in the British Isles, the “Purple Emperor” is in a class of its own. Apart from the fact that it is so magnificent, most people have never been priviledged to see it in the wild, and collectors regard it as the greatest prize of all. The entire development of this butterfly - the forests it lives in, and its unusual habits were captured on film by a small team who virtually lived with these insects for a year.

results.title: The Raft of the Medusa: five voices on colonies, nations and histories
results.brief_description: Canadian documentary filmmaker Julian Samuel presents an intellectual discourse on world history from the birth of civilization to modern day with particular focus on the Orient. In order to maintain a balanced non-European perspective, analytical interviews are conducted with Amin Maalouf (writer - ‘Leon L’African’), Thierry Hentsch (specialist, international relations - ‘Imagining the Middle East’), Nourbese Philip (writer/critic - ‘Looking for Livingstone’, ‘Frontiers’), Sara Suleri (writer/critic - ‘The Rhetoric of English India’) and Ackbar Abbas (critic - commentator on Walter Benjamin and Hong Kong cinema). This excellent and informative program covers social, economical, political, cultural and religious issues including colonialism and imperialism; capitalism and communism; European, African and Asian histories; East/West relations; fundamentalism and secularism; and major historical events such as the partition of India in 1947, the political separation of Hong Kong from China in 1949 and Hong Kong’s future with the ending of British rule by 1997, the emancipation of slaves, Occidental modernism and the rise of Islamic fundamentalism. Contains some b&w archival footage. In English and French with English subtitles.

results.title: The Puppetmaster = Hsimeng Rensheng
results.creator_credit: Xiaoxian Hou, Huakun Zhang and Quiu Fusheng
results.brief_description: ‘The Puppetmaster’ dramatises the life of 84-year-old Li Tien-Lu, Taiwan’s most famous puppeteer, who was also an actor in three of Hou’s films. The story spans the years from Li’s birth in 1909 through World War II and the end of 50 years of Japanese occupation in 1945 and uses a combination of staged scenes, performances and Li’s feisty direct addresses to the camera. Hou explains his motivation for working with Li in these terms: “I had always wanted to film Li Tien-Luk as a subject because I feel that he is like a living encyclopaedia of Chinese tradition. In filming him, it is as if I am flicking through the pages of this encyclopaedia. He is different from our generation, has none of the modern penchant for rationalization, none of our setbacks or negative qualities, or our pain. People from that age would tackle problems with flexibility but from a strong principled position. Life and death and social relationships to them are straightforward propositions. Simply put, I see in Li Tien-Luk the ardent self-confidence of the Chinese and their generosity of heart. In modern Taiwan, these qualities have all but vanished.” ‘The Puppetmaster’ is the first instalment of Hou’s ‘Taiwan Triology’ covering the history of Taiwan from the Japanese occupation to Japan’s surrender. Cast includes Li Tien-lu, Lin Chung, Cheng Kuei-Chung and Hung Liu. In Mandarin and Taiwanese with English subtitles.
